description: Founded in 2006, Peak XV Partners is a Venture Capital firm. The company, previously known as Sequoia Capital India & SEA, prides itself on its relentless pursuit of investing in businesses that face and overcome challenges to achieve long-lasting greatness. Their investing scope is broad, focusing on early-stage to growth-stage ventures regardless of sector. Among their diverse portfolio of 369 companies, notable investments include Leap, FPL Technologies, Atlan, Stanza Living, and Apna Mart.
name: Peak XV Partners

description: Founded in 2016, Venture Catalysts is a Venture Capital firm dedicated to creating a prominent startup ecosystem. With a global presence across over 50 cities, Venture Catalysts aims to democratise angel investing, empowering startup founders with their unique syndicate of resources. The firm primarily invests in early-stage and growth-stage startups with a focus on sectors such as Ecommerce, Enterprise Tech, Fintech, Health Tech, and Media & Entertainment. Venture Catalysts boasts 243 companies in its portfolio, with notable investments in Zypp Electric, Progcap, GOQii, Melorra, and CityMall.
name: Venture Catalysts

description: LetsVenture is a company based in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India, operating in the fintech sector. Founded in 2013 and the company was established by Sanjay Jha, Shanti Mohan.
name: LetsVenture

description: Founded in 2018, Inflection Point Ventures is a Venture Capital firm that seeks to drive exponential value creation by connecting a vast and diverse investor community with startups, primarily in India. The firm proactively provides both monetary and non-monetary support to the startups they invest in, maintaining transparency around valuation and due diligence outcomes. Inflection Point Ventures principally invests in early-stage and growth-stage startups across enterprise tech, ecommerce, fintech, edtech, as well as media and entertainment sectors. The firm has a total of 215 companies in its portfolio, with notable investments including STAGE, Hudle, Escrowpay, Ethereal Machines, and Reloy.
name: Inflection Point Ventures

description: Founded in 2011, Blume Ventures is a Venture Capital firm that specialises in not only funding but also in active mentoring of startups. The firm takes particular interest in tech-led startups, led by founders seeking to resolve distinctly Indian problems impacting large markets, indicating a clear vision to be a consequential platform for such ventures in India. Primarily investing in early-stage and growth-stage startups, Blume Ventures has a keen interest in sectors such as fintech, enterprise tech, e-commerce, consumer services, and edtech. The firms impressive portfolio includes 211 companies, with notable investments in enterprises like Zopper, Stellapps, Purplle, Euler Motors, and GreyOrange.
name: Blume Ventures

description: Founded in 1983, Accel is a venture capital firm dedicated to partnering with exceptional teams at every stage of private company growth. Accel perceives its role as more than just an investment partner, striving to assist ambitious entrepreneurs in establishing iconic global businesses. The firm primarily invests in seed stage and growth stage start-ups across a variety of sectors, including enterprise tech, ecommerce, fintech, health tech, and media & entertainment. With a portfolio comprising 201 companies, some of Accels notable investments include Spinny, Captain Fresh, Eruditus, Haber, and Money View.
name: Accel

description: Founded in 2006, Mumbai Angels is an angel network investment firm, centrally situated in Mumbai, as part of IIFL Wealth & Asset Management, also recognised as 360 ONE. The firm is noted for its process-driven and algorithmic approach to early-stage venture investments, ensuring not only the quality of invested startups but also focusing on the successful exit of those investments. Mumbai Angels shows a particular interest towards early-stage startups in sectors such as enterprise tech, ecommerce, media & entertainment, edtech, and clean tech. The firms portfolio includes a robust 185 companies, with notable investments in Vahdam Teas, AppsDaily, Purplle, Exotel, and Tonbo Imaging.
name: Mumbai Angels

description: Founded in 2006, Indian Angel Network is an Angel Network firm that strives to facilitate seed and early-stage investment for entrepreneurs, with investment options ranging from Rs. 50 lakhs to Rs. 50 crores. The firm provides not only financial support but also mentoring from successful entrepreneurs and facilitates global market access. The firm primarily invests in early and growth stage startups, with no specific sector focus, however, it has shown interest in sectors such as enterprise tech, ecommerce, and edtech. Currently, the firm has funded over 171 companies, with notable investments including goSTOPS, Papa Pawsome, Zypp Electric, Huddle, and Wow! Momo amongst others.
name: Indian Angel Network

description: Founded in 2015, Titan Capital is a Venture Capital firm that capitalises on investing behind entrepreneurs with an aim to create a significant positive impact on India and the global stage. Titan Capital typically enters as the first investor during the pre-seed and seed stages and accompanies the entrepreneurs throughout their company-building journey. The firm primarily invests in early and growth-stage startups across various sectors, including ecommerce, enterprise tech, media & entertainment, fintech, and health tech. Titan Capitals investment portfolio consists of 148 companies, with notable investments in startups such as Park+, VeGrow, Khatabook, FleetX, and CityMall.
name: Titan Capital

description: Founded in 2011, Elevation Capital is a Venture Capital firm that partners with visionary founders particularly in the early and growth stages of startup development. This VC firm avows that its perfectly suitable for nascent startups to make contact. The investment focus gravitates towards varied sectors, including Ecommerce, Fintech, Enterprise Tech, Media & Entertainment, and Edtech. The firm currently holds investment in 144 portfolio companies, with notable investments including AppsForBharat, Zopper, SarvaGram, Ummeed Housing Finance, and VeGrow.
name: Elevation Capital

description: Established in 2005, Brand Capital is a Corporate Venture Capital firm. The firm, part of Bennett, Coleman & Co. Ltd., takes a hands-on approach, partnering with ambitious entrepreneurs to build strong brands and help businesses grow through effective marketing and strategic advice. Their strategy extends across various sectors, primarily focusing on early-stage injections within ecommerce, consumer services, and health tech. To date, the companys portfolio extends to 143 companies, encompassing notable investments such as GoMechanic, Healthians, Toppr, HomeLane, and Country Delight.
name: Brand Capital

description: Established in 2020, 100Unicorns is an accelerator investment firm located in India. The firm uniquely operates as an accelerator, investing in very early-stage start-ups and intending to revolutionise the idea-stage funding sphere in the country by providing founders with early access to capital and mentorship. The companys primary focus lies in the early and growth stages of investment, with a sector-agnostic approach that has seen engagements in ecommerce, fintech, enterprise tech, and health tech sectors. To date, the firm has invested in a total of 141 portfolio companies, including prominent names such as Zingbus, Power Gummies, Zypp Electric, BluSmart, and Rupeek.
name: 100Unicorns

description: Founded in 2019, 100X.VC is a Venture Capital firm that prides itself on being the first VC to invest in early-stage startups using India SAFE Notes. The firm is dedicated to working in close partnership with founders after investment, offering services akin to those of a coach, strategy consultant, and investment banker. Their aim is to nurture fragile ideas and help companies advance to subsequent funding rounds. The firm primarily invests in early-stage startups across sectors such as Enterprise Tech, Ecommerce, Consumer Services, Fintech, and Health Tech. With a substantial portfolio consisting of 130 companies, it counts abCoffee, EMO, Data Sutram, Dezy, and EasyReplenish among its notable investments.
name: 100X.VC

description: Founded in 2006, Z47 is a Venture Capital firm that has a significant footing in the Indian and global markets. In its investment strategy, the firm prioritises a founder s first approach, committing on a personal level to assist in creating world-altering organisations. The firm s attention primarily lies in early-stage and growth-stage startups across various sectors, including e-commerce, fintech, enterprise tech, travel tech, and media & entertainment. Matrix Partners India has a well-diversified portfolio, with total investments in 121 companies and notable investments in firms like The Whole Truth, SuperOps, Foxtale, OneCard, and Jupiter.
name: Z47

description: Founded in 2008, InnoVen Capital is a Venture Debt firm that pioneered the concept of venture debt and specialty lending in India. The companys chief objective is to provide support to entrepreneurs who are engaged in disruptively large addressable markets. Their investment focus is chiefly towards growth and late-stage startups in sectors such as Ecommerce, Enterprise Tech, Fintech, Edtech, and Health Tech. To date, InnoVen Capital has a portfolio of 123 companies, with notable investments including Lendingkart, Udaan, BharatPe, Rebel Foods, and LetsTransport.
name: InnoVen Capital

description: Established in 2006, Chiratae Ventures is a venture capital firm that is recognised for its focus on the technology industry in India. Chiratae Ventures is prominently recognised as an advisory for funds, accumulating a total of $1.3 billion in assets under management across 7 funds, coupled with 4 IPOs, 8 Unicorns and 56 exits. The firm is primarily invested in early and growth-stage startups within the enterprise tech, ecommerce, health tech, fintech, and edtech sectors. To date, Chiratae Ventures has built a portfolio of 121 companies, including significant investments in Vayana Network, Fibe, RentoMojo, Bizongo, and Pixis.
name: Chiratae Ventures

description: Founded in 2006, Kalaari Capital is a Venture Capital firm based in Bengaluru, India. The firm is an early-stage technology investor, committed to empowering visionaries striving to redesign Indian lifestyles, work culture, consumption and transactions. Kalaari focusses on early and growth-stage investments, particularly in the sectors of Ecommerce, Enterprise Tech, Fintech, Media & Entertainment, and Health Tech. The companys portfolio includes a total of 117 companies, notably HealthPlix, Chalo, ElasticRun, MyGlamm, and Vogo.
name: Kalaari Capital

description: Founded in 2017, Alteria Capital is a Venture Debt firm operating in India. The firm was established by the leadership team from Silicon Valley Bank s lending business in India and is known for its commitment to helping visionary entrepreneurs grow their businesses to their full potential. Alteria Capital s focus primarily rests on growth and late-stage investments and is sector-agnostic though it has been noted for its dealings in ecommerce, fintech, and enterprise tech sectors. With a total of 101 companies in its portfolio, some of its most notable investments include BharatPe, AdvantageClub, Rebel Foods, Country Delight, and Ola Electric.
name: Alteria Capital

description: Established in 2015, 3one4 Capital is a venture capital firm based in Bengaluru, India. Their investing strategy revolves around targeting certain market categories poised for growth and ready to welcome innovative products or services. Key areas of interest include SaaS, Enterprise & SMB Automation, Fintech, Consumer Internet, and Digital Health, combining machine-learning technologies, digital media and climate tech. Concentrating primarily on early to growth stage investments, the firm focuses on industry sectors such as Fintech, Enterprise Tech, Ecommerce, Media & Entertainment, and Health Tech. With a portfolio of 98 companies, significant investments from the firm have been channelled into startups like Kapiva, BetterPlace, Kuku FM, Open Money, and DarwinBox.
name: 3one4 Capital

description: Founded in 2015, Trifecta Capital Advisors is a venture debt firm. The firm has established itself as a robust venture financing platform in India, offering growth equity, credit, and financial advisory services while maintaining a commitment to partnering with exceptional entrepreneurs through various stages of their startup journeys. Trifecta Capital primarily invests in growth and late-stage startups across sectors such as ecommerce, fintech, enterprise tech, foodtech, and health tech. With 97 companies in their portfolio, some of their notable investments include BharatPe, Bobble AI, Atomberg Technology, Chalo, and Cashfree Payments.
name: Trifecta Capital Advisors

description: Founded in 2011, India Quotient is a Venture Capital firm that supports founders with not only investment but also strategic assistance. The firm adopts a flexible approach whilst striving to accelerate founders capabilities, demonstrated by their readiness to invest even at the paper stage, and enabling many of their startup partners to bypass the angel round. With a principal focus on early and growth stage businesses in sectors such as Media & Entertainment, Ecommerce, Fintech, Enterprise Tech, and Agritech, India Quotient has built a robust portfolio. The firm currently boasts 92 portfolio companies and has made notable investments in companies like Kuku FM, FleetX, ShareChat, FabAlley, and Lendingkart.
name: India Quotient

description: Founded in 2009, ah! Ventures is a Venture Capital firm focused on fostering growth in the startup ecosystem. ah! Ventures distinguishes itself as a fundraising platform for early-stage startups, curating promising businesses and providing a unique blend of services, skills, and industry experience to both entrepreneurs and investors. The firm primarily invests in early-stage and growth-stage startups across sectors such as edtech, ecommerce, enterprise tech, media & entertainment, and travel tech. To date, they have invested in 89 companies, with significant investments in Zappfresh, Kyte Energy, Eduncle, Stylework, and Smart Institute.
name: ah! Ventures

description: Established in 2014, Axilor Ventures is a Venture Capital firm that actively partakes in seed funding. Dedicated to invigorating startups in various sectors such as Enterprise Tech, E-Commerce, Fintech, Media & Entertainment, and Health Tech, the firm is highlighted for its investment operations in Supply Chain, B2B Commerce, Agri, Healthcare, Climate & Fintech sectors. Primarily focused on early and growth-stage investments, Axilor Ventures boasts an extensive portfolio of 88 companies inclusive of notable investments in SigTuple, CapGrid Solutions, Alyve Health, Metalbook, and Wiz Freight.
name: Axilor Ventures

description: Founder and CEO at Livspace | Ex- Livspace | Angel Investor
